meanings.sent1: After the storm, they needed to restrengthen the damaged roof.
meanings.sent2: The athlete worked hard to restrengthen his muscles after the injury.
meanings.sent3: The superhero had to restrengthen his powers before facing the villain.
meanings.sent4: She decided to restrengthen her resolve and face her fears head-on.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge needed to restrengthen its supports to withstand the heavy traffic.

meanings.sent1: The patient slowly began to restrengthen after the illness.
meanings.sent2: The plant started to restrengthen once it received more sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The tired runner had to restrengthen for the final sprint of the race.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence started to restrengthen as she achieved small victories.
meanings.sent5: The team needed to restrengthen their bond to work effectively together.
